Style: Romanesque; High Gothic (those parts dated to 1375-1400)
Form of Initials: Ornamented large (4-5 lines) and small initials (2 lines). Small initials are usually painted as Lombard letters.
Iconography: Five historiated miniatures are found in the manuscript. On the fragmented f. 1r (a breaking wheel and a killing scene featuring a victim on the left the killer standing behind the victim with a sword on the right; and on f. 72r; f. 81r; f. 85r and f. 90r fighting scenes featuring two (f. 72r; f. 85r) and three (f. 81r; f. 90r) figures. In addition; on f. 93r; the flaggellation of a single figure and the hanging of three figures is depicted. All of these sections refer to the respective sections of the MEL (on homicide and on theft). Otherwise; the manuscript contains fifteen large initials (4 -5 lines) on f. 3r22-26; f. 14v16-22; f. 25v16-21; f. 32r1-5; f. 41v1-4; f. 45v1-4; f. 47v13-16; f. 52r5-8; f. 56v21-24; f. 64r11-16; f. 74r1-4; f. 82r1-4; f. 86r1-4; f. 91r1-4 and f. 95r1-5. In addition; on f. 39r; two ornamented medium initials are found; but it seems they are part of a palimsest as both the featured texts is wiped out and also the featured colours and the style of the paintings are different from the other sections of the manuscript.

On the fragmented f. 1r (a breaking wheel and a killing scene featuring a victim on the left the killer standing behind the victim with a sword on the right; and on f. 72r; f. 81r; f. 85r and f. 90r fighting scenes featuring two (f. 72r; f. 85r) and three (f. 81r; f. 90r) figures. In addition; on f. 93r; the flaggellation of a single figure and the hanging of three figures is depicted. All of these sections refer to the respective sections of the MEL (on homicide and on theft). Otherwise; the manuscript contains fifteen large initials (4 -5 lines) on f. 3r22-26; f. 14v16-22; f. 25v16-21; f. 32r1-5; f. 41v1-4; f. 45v1-4; f. 47v13-16; f. 52r5-8; f. 56v21-24; f. 64r11-16; f. 74r1-4; f. 82r1-4; f. 86r1-4; f. 91r1-4 and f. 95r1-5. In addition; on f. 39r; two ornamented medium initials are found; but it seems they are part of a palimsest as both the featured texts is wiped out and also the featured colours and the style of the paintings are different from the other sections of the manuscript.

Form of Initials: Ornamented large (6 lines); miedum (3 lines) and small initials (1 line). Small initials are painted as Lombard letters.
Iconography: A heraldic minoature with gold lettering is found on f. 2v. In additon; on f. 3v; an inhabited main initial contains a dragon figure in the initial in the form of an S. Iconography: None. Nine Lombard or ornamented and at times foliated main initials on f. 5r12-18; f. 16r1-13; f. 27r23-27; f. 37v12-17 (?); f. 38v18-22 (?) (left empty); f. 46v 22-28 (left empty); f. 75r7-12 (left empty); f. 83r22-31; f. 97r11-18 (?). In addition; three medium initials as Lombard letters on f. 89r1-3; f. 92v14-16 and f. 105r14-16.
Literature: Collin (1827:XXVII-XXVIII); Schlyter (1869:VIII-IX); Klemming (1881-1882:530); Holm (1988:32-34); Åström (2003); Åström (2013)

Catch Words and Gatherings: Yes. Custodes in each gathering; apart from the gatherings VIII; XII; XV and the paper gatherings prior and after the parchment parts.
Form of Initials: Large ornamented initials (7-8 lines) and small initials (2-3 lines)
Iconography: The manuscript features four historiated initials; of which the first two are embellished with gold. The historiated initials are on f. 2r4-10 (Konungabalken; ch. 1; Showing a frontally seated and crowned king holding the imperial orb; dressed in green and white); f. 12r1-10 (Edsöresbalk; ch. 1; Showing a frontally seated king holding an open book and a sceptre; flanked by to bishops; all placed in architectural framing); f. 32r1-8 (Vådamål och såramål; ch. 1; A killing scene showing two men fighting with swords. One has lost his head. In the foreground a further figure is depicted looking at the homicide scene); f. 56v8-15 (Ärvdabalken; ch. 1; Showing a dying man in bed in the foreground and two mourning women behind and on the left). In addition; Christ on the cross is depicted in the lower right margin on f. 39v. According to AV; the manuscript contains altogether 22 large initials.

Colours: R, Light R, B, Y, G
Form of Initials: Small lombard initials (2 lines) and ornamented large initials (8 lines)
Iconography: None (as far as is known). In addition, on f. 15v a large geneological table is painted in R, G, Y and B.
